newsitem.title: USA: NYC picks new syndicates for GOs, agency bonds.
newsitem.headline: NYC picks new syndicates for GOs, agency bonds.

text.p: New York City on Friday announced the winners of its hotly-contested syndicate positions, doling out some of the most lucrative work in the municipal market to a revamped slate of firms.
The city gave senior manager positions for upcoming general obligation bond deals to Goldman Sachs & Co, J.P. Morgan & Co, and Travelers Group Inc's Smith Barney Inc.
The city said it cut from five to three the number of senior managers on GO deals, and increased the number of senior co-managers to 10 from six.
Lehman Brothers Holdings Inc, Bear Stearns Cos Inc and Morgan Stanley Dean Witter Discover & Co won the senior manager slots for the city's newly-created Transitional Finance Authority.

The selection of Morgan Stanley marked the first time since the mid-1980s that the firm has been appointed a rotating book-running senior manager on a city-related bond financing authority, the city said.

First Albany Corp, which according to a city press release has never before held a book-running senior manager slot on city agency deal, was named a senior manager for New York's Municipal Water Finance Authority. Also selected senior managers for the water authority were Merrill Lynch & Co Inc and PaineWebber Group Inc.
